intro: Nicotiana exasperata, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Nicotiana exasperata is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and tobacco.
